climbs.name: Wild Kingdom
climbs.fa: Chris Miller, Chuck Scott, Loren Scott, Lisa Guindon, Pete Paredes & Tyler Logan, June 2001

content.description:
Climb cracks and small features on the face to a crux leaving the arching crack, maneuvering past small holds to the upper horizontal. After clipping the last bolt a few more nice face moves take you up and over the top to the anchor.

Due to the sharp edge of the anchor ledge, you might want to top-belay and move over to the anchor for

March of Dimes

to rappel (to the left of Wild Kingdom when looking at the rock).
content.location: Wild Kingdom ascends the right side of the main face of Mad Cow Wall at at a sideways Y crack, just left of the obvious bulge.

content.description:
A short section of thin edges past two bolts is the crux and gains a slanting ledge system above which easier face moves past two more bolts lead to the top.

The anchors are on a ledge and due to the position there's some rope drag - perhaps best to rap off as opposed to lowering to spare your cord.
content.location:
Located in the middle of the face between

Branding Iron

and

Wild Kingdom

.

content.description:
The crux is the first 10 feet off the ground. Follow a left slanting crack then right onto an oddly featured face. Â A low angled slab leads to the "gorilla's head". Use caution until you stand on top of the head and reach across to clip the last bolt. A fall on this part could cause decking on the low angle slab.

Anchor placement makes cleaning awkward.
content.location: Far right side of Mad Cow Wall. Start climbing at the lowest part of the rock.

content.description:
The first bolt is there to keep you from tumbling to the rocks below, not so much as to protect against decking.

A couple nice .10a moves get you to a great stance for the second clip. A few more thin moves bring you to the crux passing the third bolt. This is a great move that requires great finger and core strength. Bigger holds take you to the final jugs (on a big mushroom cap) and the anchor.

To avoid rope wear, top-belay and rappel to descend.
content.location: This is the bolted line on the pillar to the right of Wild Kingdom.

content.description:
Start just left of

Down with the Herd

and climb past a bolt (crux) into the obvious wide crack. Slither up until possible to cut right to anchors atop

Down with the Herd

.
content.location: Located between Wild Kingdom and Down with the Herd.

climbs.name: Branding Iron
climbs.fa: Chris Miller, Lisa Guindon, Loren Scott, Chuck Scott, Pete Paredes & Tyler Logan, June 2001

content.description:
Climbs a nice crack/flake on gear to a small stance and then continues up past a strenuous mantle and fingery edges to anchors on the left side of a large ledge.

The anchors are on a ledge and due to the position there's some rope drag - perhaps best to rap off as opposed to lowering to spare your cord.
content.protection: 3 bolts, gear to 2 inches, chain anchors
content.location:
Located on the far left side of the crag just left of

March of Dimes

.

content.description:
Located on the left side of the narrow pillar with

Down with the Herd

. Start up

Cowdura

and then continue up the faint arete with balancy and technical movement, cutting right at the top to the anchors.
content.location:
Right side of the face and left of

Down with the Herd

.

content.description: Starts on the left side of the face and follows the obvious right-arching crack/flake system to finish in a notch just right of Wild Kingdom.
